snippet: As many as 30 people were killed in India during a dash to get to the Hindu festival of Kumbh Mela, which was expected to draw 80 million pilgrims.
abstract: As many as 30 people are killed in stampede at train station in Allahabad, India, at height of Kumbh Mela, Hindu religious festival that takes place every 12 years; millions upon millions of people had converged on the site, and witnesses say stampede was set off when passengers rushed up steps leading to a platform already overcrowded because of railway delays.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hari Kumar and Raksha Kumar from Allahabad, and Heather Timmons and Malavika Vyawahare from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: As many as 30 people were killed in India during a dash to get to the Hindu festival of Kumbh Mela, which was expected to draw 80 million pilgrims.

headline.seo: Deadly Stampede at the Hindu Festival Kumbh Mela
headline.main: Deadly Stampede at Hindu Festival That Draws Millions
headline.print_headline: Deadly Stampede at Hindu Festival That Draws Millions
